description: From Latin ambiēns (“going around”), from ambiō (“go around”).

adjectives.description: ambient (comparative more ambient, superlative most ambient)

entries.meaning: Encompassing on all sides; surrounding; encircling; enveloping.
examples: A cup of warm tea eventually cools to the ambient temperature.

entries.meaning: (music) Evoking or creating an atmosphere: atmospheric.
Relating to, or suitable for, storage at room temperature.
(mathematics) Containing objects or describing a setting that one is interested in.
Something that surrounds; encompassing material, substance or shape.
examples: Much after this same manner, when the Air is exceeding cold through which it passes; do we find the drops of Rain, falling from the Clouds, congealed into round Hail-stones by the freezing Ambient.

entries.meaning: (astrology) The atmosphere; the surrounding air or sky; atmospheric components collectively such as air, clouds, water vapour, hail, etc.
examples: It might be also, that attracted by that great void Vacuum ... all the ambients would be rarified, and particularly, the air.

entries.meaning: (uncountable, music) A type of modern music that creates a relaxing and peaceful atmosphere.
examples: Ambient can be flabby synth mulch that needs to access cyberism and external philosophies to convince you you're not being scammed.
